description: 100 concept-only multiple-choice questions from WCBA-CNTX Training Guide (ignores exercises and knowledge checks).

questions.text: Which responsibilities fall under a Windchill business administrator?
options: Develop ERP code and manage payroll
Author CAD geometry and run simulations
Configure policies, processes, and participants; manage data and system behavior
Operate network firewalls and storage arrays

questions.text: What do domain policies typically include?
options: Access rules, notification rules, and indexing rules
Browser settings, printer queues, and CSS themes

questions.text: What is the purpose of life cycles in Windchill?
options: Represent object maturity states and transitions

questions.text: How are workflows used?
options: Automate processes, pass tasks, and drive states

questions.text: Who are participants in Windchill?
What do roles represent in Windchill?
What do teams do in Windchill?
options: Map participants to roles for contexts and processes

questions.text: Which tiers are in Windchill architecture?
What is a Windchill context?
options: A defined container where users work and data reside

questions.text: Why is context strategy important?
options: Balances admin requirements and logical information storage

questions.text: Which three framework levels exist?
What is the Site context used for?
What does an Organization context represent?
options: A major business unit/division; admin info and rules

questions.text: Which application contexts are available?
Typical product context characteristics?
options: Stores product definition, structures, and related business info

questions.text: Typical library context characteristics?
options: Stores reusable, cross-product data and standards

questions.text: Typical project context characteristics?
options: Tracks plans, activities, deliverables; supports collaboration

questions.text: Typical program context characteristics?
What elements define a context setup?
options: Folder structure, team, domain policies, OIR

questions.text: Why use folders?
options: Ease finding info and apply access control to sensitive data

questions.text: What do context templates establish?
options: Initial settings for structure, roles, policies, OIR, lifecycle, workflows

questions.text: Who can use product/library templates?
options: Organization administrators and designated context creators

questions.text: Benefits of templates for administrators?
options: Consistency, reduced setup burden, transferable environments

questions.text: CAD document templates availability?
options: Site-level to all orgs; org-level to its contexts; sub-org to that context

questions.text: Which Home page tabs exist for admins?
What can admins do on the Public Home tab?
options: Configure standard tables and layout for all users

questions.text: What does the Windchill calendar define?
Out-of-the-box non-working days?
Preference Management enables?
options: Set defaults per context; lock or allow overrides

questions.text: Users can set personal preferences for?
options: Display, content, search, tables, visualization, workspace, object types

questions.text: Difference between preferences and properties?
options: Preferences via UI per context; properties via files requiring restart

questions.text: Moving data between contexts allows you to?
options: Move objects, folders, dependent items, templates, and associated objects

questions.text: Product context sizing guidance?
Organization context properties include?
options: Business rules, preferences, configuration, access control

questions.text: Participants referenced by policies and workflows are?
Which contexts are typically used for storing business objects?
Which items context creators commonly manage?
options: Team roles, folders, templates, policies, OIR

questions.text: Which admin element may be locked to avoid overrides?
Where are global templates for organizations listed?
Programs are intended to?
options: Link projects and centralize planning, not store design data

questions.text: Library templates example purpose?
options: Document Library sets folders, team, OIR, access policies

questions.text: Calendar delegation applies on?
options: Individual user calendars for periods or indefinite

questions.text: Preference 'scope' refers to?
Which tool manages participants?
Home page default tables include?
Site context may contain?
Who are context creators?
options: Members allowed to create/manage application contexts

questions.text: Moving life cycle/workflow templates across hierarchy?
options: From lower to higher contexts via Move action

questions.text: Templates ensure?
options: Consistency and efficiency in new context setup

questions.text: Visualization publication worker purpose?
Indexing Server provides?
Enterprise directory example?
Product creators group controls?
Library creators group controls?
Projects are not hierarchical meaning?
options: Products cannot be nested inside projects

questions.text: Programs visibility characteristic?
options: Provide central navigation; not directly visible as data stores

questions.text: Context setup often includes defining?
options: Team templates and access control policies

questions.text: Who typically manages libraries after creation?
Where to set user personal preferences?
Calendar maintenance is conducted at?
Non-working day impact?
options: Workflow deadlines use working days, not calendar days

questions.text: Preference Manager descriptions include?
Organization context automatically associates with?
Restricted Directory Search option controls?
options: Interaction with users not in organization

questions.text: Allow all members to create projects affects?
Template Save as from product creates?
options: Product context template from existing product

questions.text: Site templates may be limited by?
Document templates benefit users by?
options: Providing style, structure, layout and boilerplate

questions.text: Note templates provide?
Which item is set via context templates (variant 70)?
options: Folder structure, roles, policies, OIR, lifecycle, workflows
